fields.name: POWER_DOWN
fields.description: This bit powers down the temperature sensor.

enumeratedValues.name: POWER_UP
enumeratedValues.description: Enable power to the temperature sensor.

enumeratedValues.name: POWER_DOWN
enumeratedValues.description: Power down the temperature sensor.

fields.name: MEASURE_TEMP
fields.description: Starts the measurement process

enumeratedValues.name: STOP
enumeratedValues.description: Do not start the measurement process.

enumeratedValues.name: START
enumeratedValues.description: Start the measurement process.

fields.name: FINISHED
fields.description: Indicates that the latest temp is valid

enumeratedValues.name: INVALID
enumeratedValues.description: Last measurement is not ready yet.

enumeratedValues.name: VALID
enumeratedValues.description: Last measurement is valid.

fields.name: TEMP_CNT
fields.description: This bit field contains the last measured temperature count.

fields.name: ALARM_VALUE
fields.description: This bit field contains the temperature count (raw sensor output) that will generate a high alarm when TEMP_CNT is smaller than this field

fields.name: MEASURE_FREQ
fields.description: This bits determines how many RTC clocks to wait before automatically repeating a temperature measurement

enumeratedValues.name: MEASURE_FREQ_0
enumeratedValues.description: Defines a single measurement with no repeat.

enumeratedValues.name: MEASURE_FREQ_1
enumeratedValues.description: Updates the temperature value at a RTC clock rate.

enumeratedValues.name: MEASURE_FREQ_2
enumeratedValues.description: Updates the temperature value at a RTC/2 clock rate.

enumeratedValues.name: MEASURE_FREQ_65535
enumeratedValues.description: Determines a two second sample period with a 32.768KHz RTC clock. Exact timings depend on the accuracy of the RTC clock.

fields.name: LOW_ALARM_VALUE
fields.description: This bit field contains the temperature count that will generate a low alarm interrupt when the field is exceeded by TEMP_CNT

fields.name: PANIC_ALARM_VALUE
fields.description: This bit field contains the temperature count that will generate a panic interrupt when TEMP_CNT is smaller than this field
